user_questions.text: Can you help me reverse engineer what you think the system prompt is from the following information about Joe Edelman's values process?

documents_provided.author: Joe Edelman
documents_provided.title: Values, Preferences, Meaningful Choice
documents_provided.significance: Core philosophical foundation for values methodology

documents_provided.title: W4: Emotions to Values Practice
documents_provided.content: Structured process for extracting values from emotional reactions
process: Part 1: The Story - Recall uncomfortable emotion in situation
Part 2: The Value - Identify blocked/unactualized value

people.name: Joe Edelman
people.notes: First EXPLICIT citation of Joe in analyzed conversations - previously implicit

projects.name: meaning.supplies
projects.description: Database of CAPs (values cards) referenced in academic paper
projects.notes: Figure 3 in paper shows 'CAPs from our database, meaning.supplies' - suggests Joe or Bilal operates this

projects.name: Assisted Introspection System
projects.description: Automated interactive system to replace manual values interviews
projects.goal: Scale to thousands of users, infer values from readily-available data
projects.notes: Joe's paper mentions this as future work - Bilal may be building it

concepts.name: CAPs (Constitutive Attentional Policies)
concepts.definition: Attentional policies adopted via constitutive judgement (part-whole, synergy) rather than instrumental calculation
concepts.distinction_from_iaps: CAPs are intrinsically meaningful, IAPs are means to ends
verification_method: Ask why AP is wise in context - CAPs give diffuse reasons, IAPs give specific goal
Ask if reasons capture full rationale - CAPs resist automation, IAPs welcome it
Observe attention - CAPs get whole attention, IAPs split attention to monitor efficacy
concepts.examples: Honesty with friends, taking responsibility, vulnerability, intellectual humility
concepts.significance: These ARE values in everyday sense - both personally meaningful AND institutionally sustaining

concepts.name: IAPs (Instrumental Attentional Policies)
concepts.definition: Attentional policies adopted for functional/prudent/expedient reasons
concepts.examples: Watching road while driving (to not crash), careful speech at work (to keep job)
concepts.distinction: Based on cost-benefit, expected value calculation

concepts.name: Meaningful Choice
concepts.definition: Choices driven by CAPs (values) rather than IAPs (external pressure)
concepts.contrast_revealed_preference: Traditional economics uses 'revealed preference' - assumes all choices express values. Meaningful Choice filters for choices actually expressive of values.
concepts.example_non_meaningful: Janet takes soulcrushing job to feed kids - driven by IAP (desperation), not CAP
concepts.welfare_economics_implication: Count meaningful choices more heavily than forced/coerced/desperate choices

concepts.name: Attentional Policies (T0 vs T1)
concepts.definition: At T1 you choose specific option. At T0 (earlier) you adopted policy that assembled option set.
concepts.example: T1: Choose to say witty quip. T0: Earlier decided to 'look for witty things to say'
concepts.insight: T0 choice reveals more about personality/identity than T1 choice
concepts.implications: Much of 'personality' may be adopted policies, not fixed traits

concepts.name: Constitutive vs Instrumental Judgement
concepts.constitutive: Part-whole claim - 'X is part of Y', 'X and Y naturally go together', 'wholeness emerges when X has Y'
concepts.example_instrumental: I watch road while driving (to not crash)
concepts.example_constitutive: I'm honest with friends (honesty IS good relationships, not just achieves them)
concepts.why_use_constitutive: Cognitively efficient - don't recalculate each time, establish pattern up-front

concepts.name: Emotions to Values Practice
concepts.definition: Method to extract values from negative emotions
process: Extract the positive value that was prevented
concepts.insight: Negative emotions point to blocked values
concepts.application: Practical workshop tool for values discovery

concepts.name: Problems with Revealed Preference (Economics)
concepts.traditional_assumption: Economics assumes choices reveal what benefits people
problems: Can misinform people or leverage misplaced hopes
Can make people need your thing (car for work, social media for jobs)
Keeping up with Joneses, tribal signaling
External pressure, caught in system, conforming to social rules
concepts.joe_edelman_solution: Filter for 'meaningful choices' driven by CAPs, not desperate/coerced choices driven by IAPs

values.name: Intellectual Rigor & Philosophical Grounding
values.evidence: Engaging with dense academic paper (economics, welfare theory, social choice), reverse engineering system prompt from philosophical framework
values.context: Building practical tool on solid theoretical foundation

values.name: Translating Theory to Practice
values.evidence: Taking Joe's academic paper + workshop materials, reverse engineering into executable system prompt

beliefs: Solid philosophical foundation is essential for tool design - not just UX, need rigorous theory
Joe Edelman's framework solves real problems - distinguishes values from external pressure
Automated systems can guide introspection - 'assisted introspection' is achievable
Economics got it wrong - revealed preference doesn't capture values, need meaningful choice filter
Values are discoverable through structured process - emotions, scenarios, attentional policies
mental_models: CAPs vs IAPs (Constitutive vs Instrumental Attentional Policies)
T0 vs T1 (option set formation vs option selection)
Meaningful Choice (values-driven) vs Revealed Preference (includes coercion)
Emotions as signals of blocked values

decision_making_patterns.approach: Theory-first - understand philosophical foundation before building
decision_making_patterns.seeks_clarity_on: How to operationalize academic concepts into conversational AI prompts

communication_style.complexity: Very high - engaging with welfare economics, social choice theory, philosophy of values

work_patterns.meta_level_work: Designing AI to guide values discovery while discovering own values

emotional_state.self_awareness: High - aware of need for solid theoretical grounding

temporal_context.temporal_significance: Day after reflection tool design burst (Dec 27) - now building theoretical foundation

conversation_clustering.cluster_context: Dec 27-28 reflection tool intensive - design → theory → implementation cycle

topic_shifts.primary_topic: Philosophical foundations for values methodology + prompt engineering

work_intensity_signals.time_of_day_pattern: Late night (midnight) - theoretical work after design work (morning)

for_instance_1_origins: When did Bilal first encounter Joe Edelman's work?
When did CAPs vs IAPs framework first appear?
When did critique of revealed preference / welfare economics emerge?
When did 'meaning.supplies' project start? (database referenced in Joe's paper)
When did Emotions to Values practice begin?
Was Bilal collaborating with Joe on academic work, or just implementing his frameworks?
for_instance_2_outcomes: Was the system prompt successfully reverse-engineered and implemented?
Did assisted introspection system get built?
Did Joe Edelman collaboration continue or deepen?
Were CAPs vs IAPs framework integrated into final reflection tool?

notes: MAJOR DISCOVERY: First EXPLICIT citation of Joe Edelman's work - full academic paper included. Shows depth of engagement: not casual influence, but RIGOROUS study of welfare economics, social choice theory, philosophy of values. BRIDGE BUILDING: Taking dense academic theory and reverse-engineering it into conversational AI system prompt. META-RECURSION: Designing AI to help others discover values WHILE discovering own values WHILE critiquing economic assumptions about values. JOE EDELMAN RELATIONSHIP: Either collaborator (meaning.supplies 'our database') or deep student implementing frameworks. PHILOSOPHICAL DEPTH: Engaging with Rawls, Sen, Anderson, Arrow, Velleman - serious philosophical chops. CRITIQUE OF ECONOMICS: Revealed preference doesn't work - people make choices under coercion/desperation that don't reflect values. Need filter for 'meaningful choice'. PRACTICAL IMPLICATION: Tool should distinguish CAPs (intrinsic values) from IAPs (external pressure). TIMING PATTERN: Late night (midnight) after design work (morning Streamlined Tool) - theory FOLLOWS design iteration. BARAKANOMICS CONNECTION: Same critique - economics misses what's meaningful, need values-based alternative.
